protocol_name: Immunohistochemical staining of insulin and glucagon in islets of formalin-fixed human pancreas
protocol_name_html: Immunohistochemical staining of insulin and glucagon in islets of formalin-fixed human pancreas
description: Insulin and glucagon hormones were detected in paraffin sections (4 μm thickness) of formalin-fixed human pancreases. Insulin and glucagon were detected immunohistochemically using mouse anti-human insulin mAb (ascites; Sigma) and mouse anti-porcine glucagon mAb (ascites; Sigma), respectively, with biotinylated anti-mouse IgG and avidin-biotin-complex (ABC reagent; PK-2200, Vector Labs). Background staining was checked using the corresponding isotype control Ig instead of the primary antibody. 3-amino-9-ethylcarbazole (AEC) was used as the chromogen. Stained sections were imaged using a light microscope with attached camera (Olympus BX41).
before_start:
Materials:

 

  1. Prepare graded alcohols and xylene for deparaffinizing tissue sections: 2 x xylene (250 ml/slide container), 2 x absolute ethanol (250 ml/slide container), 1 x 90% ethanol (250 ml), 1 x 70% ethanol (250 ml).

 

  1. Prepare acetate buffer components:

(i) 0.1N acetic acid: 290 μl glacial acetic acid in 50 ml deionized water

(ii) 0.1M sodium acetate: 410 mg anhydrous CH3COONa in 50 ml deionized water.

Prepare 0.1M acetate buffer (pH 5.2) by mixing 10.5 ml 0.1N acetic acid and 39.5 ml 0.1M sodium acetate.

 

  1. Prepare 18% (w/v) sodium azide.


  2. Prepare stock solution of 3-amino-9-ethylcarbazole (AEC; chromogen, 8 mg/ml: 40 mg AEC in 5 ml N-N-dimethyl formamide; protect from light and refrigerate at 4°C.


  3. Prepare M.O.M. diluent: 200 μl M.O.M. protein concentrate stock solution (Immunodetection kit, PK-2200, Vector) in 2.5 ml phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) for use either as a blocking step to minimize non-specific Ig binding or for diluting antibodies.


  4. Mabs and pAbs:

Mouse anti-human insulin mAb (ascites), Sigma-Aldrich #12018

Mouse anti-porcine glucagon mAb (ascites), Sigma-Aldrich #G2654

Biotinylated anti-mouse IgG, M.O.M immunodetection kit, Vector Labs # PK-2200

Mouse IgG1Κ , eBioscience # 14-4714-85

 

 

 

      7. Other reagents:

Hydrogen peroxide (30% w/w), Chem-Supply Pty Ltd (Australia) #HA154-500M
Methanol, Merck #106009
Sodium azide, Sigma-Aldrich #S2002
3-Amino-9-ethylcarbazole (AEC), Sigma-Aldrich #A5754
Animal free blocker, Vector Labs #SP-5030
Stock protein concentrate, M.O.M immunodetection kit, Vector Labs # PK-2200
Avidin-biotin complex (ABC), M.O.M immunodetection kit, Vector Labs # PK-2200
N-N-dimethyl formamide, Sigma #D158550
Glycergel mounting medium, Dako #C0563
protocol_affiliation: ,The John Curtin School of Medical Research, The Australian National University
manuscript_citation: Simeonovic CJ, Popp SK, Starrs LM, Brown DJ, Ziolkowski AF, Ludwig B, Bornstein SR, Wilson JD, Pugliese A, Kay TWH, Thomas HE, Loudovaris T, Choong FJ, Freeman C, Parish CR (2018) Loss of intra-islet heparan sulfate is a highly sensitive marker of type 1 diabetes progression in humans. PLoS ONE 13(2): e0191360. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0191360
keywords: Insulin immunohistochemistry, glucagon immunohistochemistry, human pancreas, ihc

authors_list.name: Sarah Popp
authors_list.affiliation: The John Curtin School of Medical Research, The Australian National University

authors_list.name: Charmaine Simeonovic
authors_list.affiliation: The John Curtin School of Medical Research, The Australian National University

components.data: Deparaffinize slides in each xylene for 1 min. rehydrate slides in graded alcohols beginning in absolute ethanol (10 dips)/ container of absolute ethanol), followed by 90% ethanol (10 dips) and 70% ethanol (10 dips). Wash well in running tap water for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Deparaffinize slides in each xylene for 1 min. rehydrate slides in graded alcohols beginning in absolute ethanol (10 dips)/ container of absolute ethanol), followed by 90% ethanol (10 dips) and 70% ethanol (10 dips). Wash well in running tap water for 5 min.

components.data: Wash 2 x 2 min in 250 ml phosphate-buffered saline (PBS).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash 2 x 2 min in 250 ml phosphate-buffered saline (PBS).

components.data: Wipe around sections with a tissue, encircle the sections using a diamond pencil and place in clean 250 ml slide container of fresh PBS. Wipe away excess PBS around each section using a tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wipe around sections with a tissue, encircle the sections using a diamond pencil and place in clean 250 ml slide container of fresh PBS. Wipe away excess PBS around each section using a tissue.

components.data: Block endogenous peroxidase activity by incubating sections in 3% hydrogen peroxide in methanol (peroxidase block working solution) for 5 min. For peroxidase block working solution add 10 μl hydrogen peroxide to 10 ml methanol; take 5ml of 3% H2O2/methanol and add 28 μl 18% (w/v) sodium azide.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Block endogenous peroxidase activity by incubating sections in 3% hydrogen peroxide in methanol (peroxidase block working solution) for 5 min. For peroxidase block working solution add 10 μl hydrogen peroxide to 10 ml methanol; take 5ml of 3% H2O2/methanol and add 28 μl 18% (w/v) sodium azide.

components.data: Wash off peroxidase block using PBS and transfer slides to a clean 250 ml slide container of fresh PBS. Wash slides 3x over 10 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash off peroxidase block using PBS and transfer slides to a clean 250 ml slide container of fresh PBS. Wash slides 3x over 10 min.

components.data: Dilute primary antibodies in diluted stock protein concentrate (diluent prepared from M.O.M. Immunodetection kit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute primary antibodies in diluted stock protein concentrate (diluent prepared from M.O.M. Immunodetection kit).

components.data: Wipe around sections using tissue to remove excess PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wipe around sections using tissue to remove excess PBS.

components.data:
Apply:

(i) 1/500 dilution of anti-insulin mAb (stock ~ 20 mg/ml) or 40 μg/ml mouse IgG1Κ (as isotype control), diluted in M.O.M. diluent, 125-150 μl/section at room temperature for 30 min.

or

(ii) 1/500 dilution of anti-glucagon mAb (stock ~ 31 mg/ml) or 62.5 μg/ml mouse IgG1Κ (as isotype control), diluted in M.O.M. diluent, 125-150 μl/section at room temperature for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Apply:

(i) 1/500 dilution of anti-insulin mAb (stock ~ 20 mg/ml) or 40 μg/ml mouse IgG1Κ (as isotype control), diluted in M.O.M. diluent, 125-150 μl/section at room temperature for 30 min.

or

(ii) 1/500 dilution of anti-glucagon mAb (stock ~ 31 mg/ml) or 62.5 μg/ml mouse IgG1Κ (as isotype control), diluted in M.O.M. diluent, 125-150 μl/section at room temperature for 30 min.

components.data: Wash off primary antibody with PBS and transfer slides to slide container with 250 ml PBS. Wash 2 x 2min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash off primary antibody with PBS and transfer slides to slide container with 250 ml PBS. Wash 2 x 2min.

components.data: Wipe around sections using tissue and incubate with 1/250 diluted secondary biotinylated-anti-mouse IgG (M.O.M immunodetection kit), 150 μl/section, for 10 min at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wipe around sections using tissue and incubate with 1/250 diluted secondary biotinylated-anti-mouse IgG (M.O.M immunodetection kit), 150 μl/section, for 10 min at room temperature.

components.data: Wash off secondary antibody with PBS and transfer to slide container with 250 ml PBS. Wash slides 2 x 2min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash off secondary antibody with PBS and transfer to slide container with 250 ml PBS. Wash slides 2 x 2min.

components.data: Wipe around sections using tissue and cover with Vectastain ABC reagent (M.O.M immunodetection kit), for 5 min at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wipe around sections using tissue and cover with Vectastain ABC reagent (M.O.M immunodetection kit), for 5 min at room temperature.

components.data: Wash off ABC reagent with PBS and transfer to slide container with 250 ml PBS. Wash slides 3x in 10 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash off ABC reagent with PBS and transfer to slide container with 250 ml PBS. Wash slides 3x in 10 min.

components.data: Prepare AEC working solution: 4.75 ml acetate buffer (see Guidelines), 0.25ml AEC stock solution and 25 μl 3% H2O2 . Filter using a disposable 0.2 μm filter. Use within 2 hours of preparation, refrigerate for short-term storage. Protect from light.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare AEC working solution: 4.75 ml acetate buffer (see Guidelines), 0.25ml AEC stock solution and 25 μl 3% H2O2 . Filter using a disposable 0.2 μm filter. Use within 2 hours of preparation, refrigerate for short-term storage. Protect from light.

components.data: Wipe around sections using tissue and cover the sections with AEC solution for 30 min at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wipe around sections using tissue and cover the sections with AEC solution for 30 min at room temperature.

components.data: Wash off AEC solution with deionized water and transfer slides to slide container with 250 ml deionized water. Wash 3x in 10min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash off AEC solution with deionized water and transfer slides to slide container with 250 ml deionized water. Wash 3x in 10min.

components.data: Lightly counterstain with Gill’s hematoxylin, wash in deionized water (2 x) and briefly dip in ammonium water (100 μl ammonia in 250 ml deionized water), 2 x 2 sec. Wash in deionized water (2 x in 250 ml) and coverslip using glycergel mounting medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Lightly counterstain with Gill’s hematoxylin, wash in deionized water (2 x) and briefly dip in ammonium water (100 μl ammonia in 250 ml deionized water), 2 x 2 sec. Wash in deionized water (2 x in 250 ml) and coverslip using glycergel mounting medium.

components.data: Photograph sections using a light microscope with camera attachment.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Photograph sections using a light microscope with camera attachment.
